casebody.data:
Edson FURTADO, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. Cornelius J. VAUGHEYS, Judge; State of Maryland, Defendants-Appellees. No. 08-6266. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted: April 24, 2008. Decided: April 30, 2008. Edson Furtado, Appellant Pro Se.

Before KING and SHEDD, Circuit Judges, and WILKINS, Senior Circuit Judge.

PER CURIAM:

Edson Furtado appeals the district court’s order denying relief on his 42 U.S.C. § 1983 (2000) complaint. We have reviewed the record and find no reversible error. Accordingly, we deny Furtado’s motion for appointment of counsel and affirm for the reasons stated by the district court. Furtado v. Vaugheys, No. 8:07-cv-03251-RWT (D.Md. Jan. 31, 2008). We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

AFFIRMED.
